üî• Let‚Äôs get that `.wav` file moved to Termux and transcribed using `whisper.cpp`‚Äîthe fast, local way. Here's the full rundown:

---

## ‚úÖ STEP 1: Move the File to Termux

Assuming you downloaded `extracted_audio.wav` to your **Downloads** folder:

### üîÅ In Termux, run:

```bash
termux-setup-storage
```

(Grant permission if prompted.)

Then move the file:

```bash
mv /sdcard/Download/extracted_audio.wav ~/extracted_audio.wav
```

‚úÖ Now the file is in your Termux `$HOME`.

---

## ‚úÖ STEP 2: Install Whisper.cpp in Termux

Make sure you‚Äôve got **build tools and Python**:

```bash
pkg update && pkg upgrade
pkg install git clang cmake ffmpeg python
```

Clone and build `whisper.cpp`:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/ggerganov/whisper.cpp
cd whisper.cpp
make
```

---

## ‚úÖ STEP 3: Download a Whisper Model

Choose a model size:
- `base.en` = fast, decent
- `small.en` = slower, better

Download it:

```bash
cd models
curl -L -o base.en.bin https://ggml.ggerganov.com/ggml-model-whisper-base.en.bin
cd ..
```

---

## ‚úÖ STEP 4: Transcribe the Audio

Run the transcription:

```bash
./main -m models/base.en.bin -f ~/extracted_audio.wav
```

This will output the full transcription right in your terminal.

---

## ‚ú® Optional: Save Output to File

```bash
./main -m models/base.en.bin -f ~/extracted_audio.wav > transcript.txt
```

Then read it anytime with:

```bash
cat transcript.txt
```

---

## üß† Want me to help parse or break down the transcript once it's done?

Drop it here after and I‚Äôll dissect the meaning, tone, gaslighting, or supernatural sauce if needed. You just tell me what lens to use.
